sentences.text: Image version: from cdimage.debian.org   Debian GNU/Linux 3.1 r4 "Sarge" - Official sparc Binary-1 CD
the raw partition table is preferred>
[O] = OK, [E] = Error (please elaborate below), [ ] = didn't try it
I can choose the language then the system will initialize Error the CD kann nicht eingebunden werden

> I can choose the language then the system will initialize Error the CD kann nicht eingebunden werden
> --
Have you tried to use the Debian Installer for Etch.

Given that Etch
release is very close now, you will probably benefit from it by
installing your Sun machine with Etch directly.
You can get D-I images from
I suggest you first try the "RC1" images.
On Sat, 09 Dec 2006 11:11:54 +0100 Liniger Simon wrote:
> Image version: from cdimage.debian.org   Debian GNU/Linux 3.1 r4 "Sarge" - Official sparc Binary-1 CD
> I can choose the language then the system will initialize Error the CD kann nicht eingebunden werden
You tried a Sarge installation, which is somewhat outdated.

The next release of Debian (called Etch) is already beeing prepared
and there are much improvements in this version.
It would be very welcome, if you could give it a try:
(this is a test version (release candidat 1) for etch)

you need internet connection
while doing the installation with this cd).
Please report, how this installation went

http://counter.li.org/,  Registered LinuxUser #311290
            Spamfiltering by bogofilter.sourceforge.net
sorry the programm doesen't work the normal mode and the epert mode are both uncompatible with my system.
On Sat, 9 Dec 2006 17:29:03 +0100 Holger Wansing wrote:
> On Sat, 09 Dec 2006 16:02:03 +0100 Liniger Simon wrote:

> > sorry the programm doesen't work the normal mode and the epert 
> > mode are both uncompatible with my system.

> We need more informations on this "incompatibility" to solve
> this:
> what happens exactly or what doesn't happen?

> In case that your english is a problem here, feel free to mail
> me directly in german.

Well, I had several mails with Simon to get the needed info,
unfortunately he didn't answer anymore to the question, if he
used rc1 images or daily builds.
So it leaves open, if kernel
2.6.17 or 2.6.18 was used; but here is what happens:
Machine is a Sun blade 100 (sparc machine).

Sarge r4 installation image boots fine, but then lacks cd detection
(cd could not be mounted).

Etch images (rc1 or daily builds ~ 20061209, not sure) boot to the
d-i boot prompt and after pressing Enter:
Could the sparc porters / kernel guys look into this?

(Ubuntu 6.06 for sparc works fine on that machine, while Ubuntu 6.10
also fails.)

On Saturday 16 December 2006 09:51, Holger Wansing wrote:

> Etch images (rc1 or daily builds ~ 20061209, not sure) boot to the
> d-i boot prompt and after pressing Enter:

In that case could you please try booting the installer with the
"video=atyfb:off" option.

With netboot I think you can do that from the OpenFirmware prompt using
   boot net install video=atyfb:off
but I don't know SunBlades, so I'm not sure.

We are closing this installation report for one of the following
reasons:
- it was reported with a pre-lenny version of Debian

- indications in the installation report give the feeling that
  the reported problem waslying in another software, unrelated to
  D-I, which we can't easily identify.

- indications in the installation report suggest that it may have been
  fixed in a more recent version of a D-I component
- it was successful and we forgot closing it..:-)
- it has no information we consider useful

The D-I team is currently in the process of cleaning out the old spool
of installation reports that haven't bene processed yet.

In case you think that the problem you reported has chances to be
still present, please reiterate your installation test with
a more recent image of D-I, if you're in position of doing this.

We recommend you choose
the netboot image, in the "daily builds section", then choose to
install "squeeze" when prompted.

If some problems are found, please report them with a new bug sent
against installation-reports.

Many thanks for your understanding and your help improving Debian,
past and present.
